medical: LEFT LOWER EXTREMITY VENOUS DOPPLER ULTRASOUND REASON FOR EXAM: Status post delivery five weeks ago presenting with left calf pain. INTERPRETATIONS: There was normal flow, compression and augmentation within the right common femoral, superficial femoral and popliteal veins. Lymph nodes within the left inguinal region measure up to 1 cm in short-axis. IMPRESSION: Lymph nodes within the left inguinal region measure up to 1 cm in short-axis, otherwise no evidence for left lower extremity venous thrombosis.
layman:
LEFT LOWER LEG VENOUS DOPPLER ULTRASOUND

Reason for exam: Five weeks after giving birth, the patient has pain in her left calf.

Findings: Blood flow, compression, and enlargement of the veins in the right thigh and behind the knee are normal. Small lymph nodes in the left groin area are up to 1 cm in size.

Conclusion: The left groin lymph nodes are up to 1 cm, but there is no sign of a blood clot in the left lower leg.
